jobs.title: Growth Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are

At Doss, we’re building an AI-native ERP to unlock the next generation of automation. Our team re-wrote 50 years of legacy software to drive a step-function improvement in how supply chain, operations, and finance organizations execute.

We need more people to help us build and sell.

Position Overview

The Growth Manager at Doss will be responsible for driving inbound demand and building a repeatable growth engine. This is a hands-on role across SEO, paid ads, content syndication, and webinars—channels that range from 0→1 to ready-to-scale. You’ll own performance across these programs and design experiments to unlock new demo volumes for our GTM team.

You’ll work directly with the Director of GTM, collaborating with marketing, sales, and product to turn qualified interest into pipeline. This is a rare opportunity to join early and build a function that you’ll eventually scale into a team.

Above all else, this role is about creating leverage—through smart systems, scalable campaigns, and clear insights that lead to better decisions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build and scale inbound channels. Launch and optimize SEO, LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads, content syndication, and webinar programs to drive demo bookings.

  • Own campaign strategy & execution. Write copy, build landing pages, set up targeting, run experiments, and track funnel performance.

  • Architect the demand engine. Design infrastructure for lead capture, enrichment, routing, attribution, and reporting.

  • Run fast, learn fast. Test constantly—offers, messaging, formats, audiences—and turn insights into repeatable growth plays.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally. Work closely with sales, product, and design to ensure tight feedback loops and sharp execution.

About You

  • High-output operator. You’re relentless about driving results. You love seeing campaign performance tick up and demo volume climb.

  • Full-stack growth marketer. From SEO to paid ads to automation, you know how to get into the weeds and make things work.

  • Conversion-oriented copywriter. You write with clarity and persuasion—whether it’s landing pages, ad copy, or email nurture.

  • Systems thinker. You see growth as more than channels—it’s data, infrastructure, coordination, and iteration.

  • Scrappy and resourceful. You are biased toward action. You test hypotheses quickly and aren’t afraid to launch v1 with duct tape if it proves the point.

  • Team-first mindset. You know how to win as part of a tight-knit team and thrive in high-trust, high-performance environments

Compensation & Benefits

  • $130K–$175K base salary + equity

  • Premium medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • Unlimited PTO + mandatory US holidays

  • 401(k) with immediate eligibility

  • Wellness, commuter, and equipment stipends

  • Catered lunch 4x/week in SF office

  • Relocation support available

jobs.title: SDR, Mid-Market
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

As a Mid-Market SDR at Doss you will be the tip of the spear in our GTM motion. You will be testing out new messaging, breaking into up-market accounts, and building the playbook as you go. You will have a real impact on our pipeline and revenue goals. The SDR team is a critical part of our growth engine. You have the opportunity to drive impact immediately and move into a closing role very quickly.

This is a sales role.

Almost all of your time will be spent prospecting and selling.

We're a sales-led-growth business.

Our product is not pure PLG or PLS. The bottom line is that we won't make money unless you SELL our product.

Responsibilities

  • Lead generation, qualification, and booking demos: Proactively identify, engage, and book demos with potential customers through various channels such as phone calls, emails, social media, our website, and in-person networking events.

  • Work leads generated from our growth marketing efforts.

  • Multi-thread accounts to get to the decision makers.

  • Collaborate with the growth and sales team to refine prospect targeting and messaging.

  • Achieve and push the limits of your quota and growth objectives.

What you're good at

  • Working insanely hard. You make things happen.

  • Pattern-matching and operating off very little information.

  • Proficient with or able to quickly learn CRM and other sales tools.

  • Working independently and able to build from the ground up.

  • Top 1% energy levels. You love talking and listening to people.

About you

  • High intensity: did we already mention that you should like working really hard?

  • Team player: we win and lose as a team, you know how to buy-into a system and play your role.

  • Curious: you will have to talk to our customers and deeply understand them and their business. You need to find this fascinating if you want to succeed.

  • Organized: you will need to be able to stay on top of all the prospects you are outreaching to and run multiple different plays without dropping the ball on any of them.

What is the opportunity for growth?

You will be one of the first SDRs and people in our sales org. You will work directly with the founders and growth leaders. If you're looking for personal growth, this is it.

As the team grows, this role will change and you'll get to choose whether you want to gravitate more towards:

  • An AE role which will be focused on expanding our ICP up-market (increasing ACVs).

  • A SDR Manager role that will be focused on scaling the org, team building, hiring, sales ops.

We have top-notch benefits

  • Premium comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Unlimited PTO and mandatory US Holidays.

  • 401(k), immediate eligibility, non-matching.

  • Fitness, commuter (BART/MUNI/CalTrain), and equipment stipends.

  • Premier office space with snacks, drinks (caffeinated, carbonated, coffee), and guest appearances by Nicolas Cage.

  • Lunch catered into office 4 days per week.

  • Relocation assistance available.

Compensation

  • The salary range for this role is $85k-$105k.

  • All compensation packages include equity because we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership. Salary and equity offered will be determined by several factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who are we

We’re building the “Terraform for operators” — an AI‑generated schema layer driving a white‑labeled data warehouse that lets physical‑goods companies evolve their systems of record as fast as their business operations change.

Think AI foundation models driving schema migrations, real‑time observability across ops/finance data, complex git versioning of schema and data changes, and workflows you compose like infrastructure code.

What you'll do

  • Design the core EAV data model & schema‑as‑code platform that powers every customer’s instance, balancing extreme flexibility with transactional integrity.

  • Build a Git‑style version‑control + migration engine capable of rolling forward/back complex schema and data changes on live production tenants in enterprise settings.

  • Engineer AI‑assisted tooling that uses foundation models to propose, validate, and apply new customer schemas and workflow definitions.

  • Scale our white‑labeled data warehouse (BigQuery/Snowflake‐like) for high‑volume, low‑latency analytics and automation workloads.

  • Create Terraform‑like declarative APIs & SDKs so ops teams can treat business processes as code while you ensure security, tenancy, and performance.

  • Deliver end‑to‑end observability & search across supply‑chain, finance, and ops data—surfacing business logic in plain language through AI‐native search.

  • Build Enterprise guard rails into a composable system to proactively detect anomalous behavior or risky emergent patterns

  • Mentor and shape engineering culture, partnering with product and design to turn unsexy back‑office pain into elegant, resilient systems loved by operators.

What you're good at

  • Expertise building large scale ETL on databases like Postgres, Elasticsearch, DuckDB, Memgraph (Graph DB), etc

  • Using cloud services to build + deploy reliable web applications

  • Working in abstractions to build complex graph-based architectures that scale

About you

  • Team player: you bring positivity, openness, and curiosity to the team every day.

  • Growth mindset: everything is an opportunity to learn and improve yourself, the team, and the company.

  • Craftsmanship: you care about making something of quality.

  • Pragmatic: you make the right decision based on circumstance, not theory.

  • Low Ego: you work best in collaborative environments where everyone supports the team.

We have top-notch benefits

  • Premium comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Unlimited PTO and mandatory US Holidays.

  • 401(k), immediate eligibility.

  • Fitness, commuter (BART/MUNI/CalTrain), and equipment stipends.

  • Premier office space with snacks, drinks (caffeinated, carbonated, coffee), and guest appearances by Nicolas Cage.

  • Lunch catered into office 4 days per week.

  • Relocation assistance available.

Compensation

  • The salary range for this role is $180k-$230k.

  • Strong equity component: we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer

Think AI foundation models driving schema migrations, real‑time observability across ops/finance data, complex git versioning of schema and data changes, and workflows you compose like infrastructure code.

What you'll do

  • Iterate quickly with Design and other engineers to deliver super-fast, extremely intuitive experiences in the web browser.

  • Contribute to technical roadmap and prioritizing features customer facing experience.

  • Create flexible infrastructure and components the scale in a composable software setting (think tools like Retool, Airtable, Zapier, Figma, Notion)

What you're good at

  • Going from 0 to 1 in ambiguous settings.

  • Fluent in Typescript, React, NextJS, and Tailwind.

  • Familiar with GraphQL, Postgres, ORMs, Node (Express).

  • Comfortable using internal APIs to build complex front-end interfaces and components.

  • Translating sophisticated Figma UI/UX into pixel perfect implementations in browser.

jobs.title: Senior Core Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

At DOSS we’re building an AI-native ERP to unlock the next generation of automation. Our team re-wrote 50 years of legacy software to drive a step-function improvement in how supply chain, operations, and finance organizations execute.

We need more people to help us build and sell.

Position Overview:

Core Operations (CoreOps) at Doss is a small group of “expert generalists” that are mobilized around the company’s hardest problems. They work directly with the CEO to identify critical directives, parachute into the part of the business that needs help, drive results, build processes, and then extract themselves.

Above all else, this role requires extremely high-quality judgement. The skills downstream of this: strong business acumen, analytical skills, precise communication, and finesse with customers. While specific areas of focus shift over time (DemandGen, Sales Ops, Implementation, Product, Talent, etc), individuals on this team will be working on the most important problems of today.

CoreOps is a fast-paced “future CEO factory” where ambitious generalists who want to build and sell can come to sharpen themselves surrounded by other A+ players.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Deliver results on mission-critical initiatives. Design, prioritize, and drive the execution of high-priority, high-scope projects, ensuring measurable outcomes that align with the company’s objectives.

  • Navigate our organization and our customers organizations. Align leadership and ICs to make decisions and deliver results.

  • Build processes that drive rigor. Go in, fix something, and put in a process to make sure it stays fixed.

  • Obsess over talent, find it, recruit it, develop it, organize it, mobilize it. CoreOps is about systematically increasing the output of the organization by making our people and systems better.

About You:

  • Exceptionally Good Judgement. In other words: you’re right, a lot. We find that high-performers make very few mistakes.

  • High-Intensity. You have experience in high-pressure roles within finance, consulting, or startup environments. These are your real preferences, not your stated preferences.

  • Intellectual Firepower. You cut through noise, synthesize, and get to the right answers fast.

  • Technical from 1st Principles. You can grok hard engineering and logic problems from a place of intuition, not memorization.

  • Systems Thinker. Everything in our business is highly interconnected across people, process, and technology. In order to make progress you need to be able to traverse it, untangle it, and put it back together.

Bonus Points:

  • Formal education in hard sciences, engineering, physics, or a related field.

  • Experience with large-scale software implementation, technical program management, or hardware engineering program management.

jobs.title: Staff Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who are we

We’re building the “Terraform for operators” — an AI‑generated schema layer driving a white‑labeled data warehouse that lets physical‑goods companies evolve their systems of record as fast as their business operations change.

Think AI foundation models driving schema migrations, real‑time observability across ops/finance data, complex git versioning of schema and data changes, and workflows you compose like infrastructure code.

What you'll do

  • Design the core EAV data model & schema‑as‑code platform that powers every customer’s instance, balancing extreme flexibility with transactional integrity.

  • Build a Git‑style version‑control + migration engine capable of rolling forward/back complex schema and data changes on live production tenants in enterprise settings.

  • Engineer AI‑assisted tooling that uses foundation models to propose, validate, and apply new customer schemas and workflow definitions.

  • Scale our white‑labeled data warehouse (BigQuery/Snowflake‐like) for high‑volume, low‑latency analytics and automation workloads.

  • Create Terraform‑like declarative APIs & SDKs so ops teams can treat business processes as code while you ensure security, tenancy, and performance.

  • Deliver end‑to‑end observability & search across supply‑chain, finance, and ops data—surfacing business logic in plain language through AI‐native search.

  • Build Enterprise guard rails into a composable system to proactively detect anomalous behavior or risky emergent patterns

  • Mentor and shape engineering culture, partnering with product and design to turn unsexy back‑office pain into elegant, resilient systems loved by operators.

What you're good at

  • Expertise building large scale ETL on databases like Postgres, Elasticsearch, DuckDB, Memgraph (Graph DB), etc

  • Using cloud services to build + deploy reliable web applications

  • Working in abstractions to build complex graph-based architectures that scale

About you

  • Team player: you bring positivity, openness, and curiosity to the team every day.

  • Growth mindset: everything is an opportunity to learn and improve yourself, the team, and the company.

  • Craftsmanship: you care about making something of quality.

  • Pragmatic: you make the right decision based on circumstance, not theory.

  • Low Ego: you work best in collaborative environments where everyone supports the team.

We have top-notch benefits

  • Premium comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Unlimited PTO and mandatory US Holidays.

  • 401(k), immediate eligibility.

  • Fitness, commuter (BART/MUNI/CalTrain), and equipment stipends.

  • Premier office space with snacks, drinks (caffeinated, carbonated, coffee), and guest appearances by Nicolas Cage.

  • Lunch catered into office 4 days per week.

  • Relocation assistance available.

Compensation

  • The salary range for this role is $200k-$280k.

  • Strong equity component: we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership.

We’re building the “Terraform for operators” — an AI‑generated schema layer driving a white‑labeled data warehouse that lets physical‑goods companies evolve their systems of record as fast as their business operations change.

  • Architect and build core frontend for our collaborative cloud platform.

jobs.title: Account Executive, Mid-Market
jobs.descriptionHtml:
This is an Account Executive role.

You and two other AEs will be the first members of the sales organization.

This is a sales role.

Almost all of your time will be spent SELLING.

We're a sales-led-growth business.

Our product is not pure PLG or PLS. Bottom line: we don't make money unless you SELL our product.

Responsibilities

  • Qualify leads: Deeply understand customer problems and qualify those within our ICP using your industry and product knowledge.

  • Own inbound: Work signups, run fast multi-channel outreach, and experiment to source, activate, and close.

  • Prospect outbound: Identify and engage high-potential accounts to create pipeline where none exists.

  • Drive deals: Run structured discovery, tailored demos, mutual close plans, and rigorous follow-up to hit targets.

  • Account expansion: Identify expansion opportunities within current customers and upsell.

  • Forecast with precision: Maintain clean pipeline hygiene and provide clear, data-backed forecasts.

What you'll do

  • Sell our core platform into Mid-Market and Enterprise businesses.

  • Build the sales motion (playbooks, talk tracks, repeatable process) from the ground up.

  • Partner with the executive team to tighten ICP, pricing, and packaging based on live feedback from the field.

  • Help build a dedicated salesforce over time (BDRs, AEs, Sales Ops).

What you're good at

  • Working insanely hard and delivering results.

  • Pattern-matching and operating with very little information.

  • Top 1% energy. You love talking with customers and you listen hard.

  • Communicating crisply in writing and on calls.

About you

  • High intensity: did we already mention that you should like working really hard?

  • Team player: we win and lose as a team; you buy into a system and play your role.

  • Curious: you will talk to customers and deeply understand them and their business—you find this genuinely interesting.

  • Comfortable with ambiguity, fast iteration, and direct feedback.

  • Prior success selling to Mid-Market or Enterprise strongly preferred.

We have top-notch benefits

  • Premium comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Unlimited PTO and mandatory US holidays.

  • 401(k), immediate eligibility, non-matching.

  • Fitness, commuter (BART/MUNI/CalTrain), and equipment stipends.

  • Premier office space with snacks and drinks (caffeinated, carbonated, coffee).

  • Lunch catered into office 4 days per week.

  • Relocation assistance available.

Compensation

  • The salary range for this role is $160k–$200k OTE.

  • All compensation packages include equity because we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership. Salary and equity offered will be determined by several factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

jobs.title: Revenue Operations (RevOps) Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Doss, we’re building an AI‑native ERP to unlock the next generation of automation. Our team re‑wrote 50 years of legacy software to drive a step‑function improvement in how supply chain, operations, and finance organizations execute. We need more people to help us build and sell.

We're seeking a founding RevOps leader to architect our go‑to‑market (GTM) machine for insane speed and precision. This is an in‑person role based in San Francisco.

This is a rare opportunity to join early and build a function that you’ll eventually scale into a team.

Above all else, this role is about creating leverage—through smart systems, scalable tools, and clear insights that lead to better decisions.

Why This Role Matters

  • $18M Series A Momentum: We've secured funding and product market fit. Now it's time to build scalable, durable systems that turn potential into performance.

  • Unified Multi‑Channel GTM: Blend inbound, outbound, and partner channels into a seamless, high‑velocity engine.

  • Technical‑First, AI‑First Culture: At Doss, RevOps is product engineering, data modeling, and process creation where everyone codes or queries and AI is embedded in our workflows.

What You’ll Own (And Iterate)

  • Systems Architecture: Design and implement the GTM data model and toolchain. Ensure clean objects, precise definitions, and eliminate data silos. Start with AI‑native approaches where appropriate.

  • Signal Integration: Aggregate first and third-party data into our stack. Automate routing, enforce SLAs, and handle deduplication flawlessly using rules plus LLM‑powered enrichment when it drives measurable lift.

  • Analytics Foundation: Create a single source of truth for pipeline and deal velocity metrics. Build dashboards that teams actually use and trust. Hold a high bar for data quality, latency, and safety across AI‑powered workflows.

  • Operational Cadence: Lead deal reviews, campaign retros, and partner pipelines with tight feedback loops and clear accountability. Collaborate with product and engineering to ship secure, reliable, and observable AI features that plug into the GTM stack.

  • AI Automation and Co‑Pilots: Build and deploy AI tools that automate repetitive RevOps tasks, enrich signals, score and route leads, draft outreach, summarize calls, and surface next‑best actions. Ship working prototypes quickly, evaluate with A/B tests and metrics, and productize what works.

Who You Are

  • Systems thinker and builder who sees growth as more than just sales calls - it's data, infrastructure, coordination, and iteration.

  • High‑intensity, high‑integrity leader who sets the pace, owns outcomes, and energizes the team.

  • Product‑oriented operator who understands APIs, webhooks, and data modeling - comfortable bridging tools and business performance.

  • AI‑fluent innovator who can design, prototype, and deploy AI workflows that transform traditional RevOps processes.

  • Clear communicator who excels in writing and presenting, from one‑on‑ones to executive reviews.

Your Experience

  • 5+ years in RevOps, Sales Ops, or GTM Ops at high‑growth B2B SaaS companies.

  • Proven track record owning the full GTM stack (CRM, enrichment, sequencing, attribution, BI) and improving funnel efficiency.

  • Hands‑on experience with AI in GTM contexts, for example:

    • Prompt and tool design for LLMs and agent workflows

    • Integrating AI with CRMs and data warehouses via APIs and webhooks

    • Shipping small services or scripts in Python/TypeScript to glue systems together

How We Operate

  • Go and See: Build deep intuition by engaging directly at the source.

  • Reality is Malleable: Shape outcomes through bold, innovative action.

  • Excellence is Mundane: Cultivate habits that compound into extraordinary results.

  • Everyone is Technical: Act as a steward of our technical culture.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity package.

  • Premium medical, dental, and vision coverage.

  • Unlimited PTO plus mandatory US holidays.

  • Immediate 401(k) eligibility (non‑matching).

  • Stipends for fitness, commuting, and equipment.

  • Lovely SF office with snacks, drinks, and provided lunch/dinner.

Compensation

  • The salary range for this role is $150K-$200K.

  • All compensation packages include equity because we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership. Salary and equity offered will be determined by several factors, including job‑related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

About Doss

Doss unifies operational data and workflows, enabling teams to operate faster with fewer tools. Backed by an $18M Series A from Theory Ventures, Contrary Capital, General Catalyst, 47th Street Partners, Base Case Capital, 20Sales, and more.

If you're passionate about engineering the backbone of software that supercharges operators, let's connect. Apply now to shape the future of enterprise automation at Doss.

 - Operational Cadence: Lead deal reviews, campaign retros, and partner pipelines with tight feedback loops and clear accountability. Collaborate with product and engineering to ship secure, reliable, and observable AI features that plug into the GTM stack.

 - AI Automation and Co‑Pilots: Build and deploy AI tools that automate repetitive RevOps tasks, enrich signals, score and route leads, draft outreach, summarize calls, and surface next‑best actions. Ship working prototypes quickly, evaluate with A/B tests and metrics, and productize what works.


WHO YOU ARE

 - Systems thinker and builder who sees growth as more than just sales calls - it's data, infrastructure, coordination, and iteration.

 - High‑intensity, high‑integrity leader who sets the pace, owns outcomes, and energizes the team.

 - Product‑oriented operator who understands APIs, webhooks, and data modeling - comfortable bridging tools and business performance.

 - AI‑fluent innovator who can design, prototype, and deploy AI workflows that transform traditional RevOps processes.

 - Clear communicator who excels in writing and presenting, from one‑on‑ones to executive reviews.


YOUR EXPERIENCE

 - 5+ years in RevOps, Sales Ops, or GTM Ops at high‑growth B2B SaaS companies.

 - Proven track record owning the full GTM stack (CRM, enrichment, sequencing, attribution, BI) and improving funnel efficiency.

 - Hands‑on experience with AI in GTM contexts, for example:
   
   - Prompt and tool design for LLMs and agent workflows
   
   - Integrating AI with CRMs and data warehouses via APIs and webhooks
   
   - Shipping small services or scripts in Python/TypeScript to glue systems together


HOW WE OPERATE

 - Go and See: Build deep intuition by engaging directly at the source.

 - Reality is Malleable: Shape outcomes through bold, innovative action.

 - Excellence is Mundane: Cultivate habits that compound into extraordinary results.

 - Everyone is Technical: Act as a steward of our technical culture.


BENEFITS

 - Competitive salary and meaningful equity package.

 - Premium medical, dental, and vision coverage.

 - Unlimited PTO plus mandatory US holidays.

 - Immediate 401(k) eligibility (non‑matching).

 - Stipends for fitness, commuting, and equipment.

 - Lovely SF office with snacks, drinks, and provided lunch/dinner.


COMPENSATION

 - The salary range for this role is $150K-$200K.

 - All compensation packages include equity because we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership. Salary and equity offered will be determined by several factors, including job‑related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.


ABOUT DOSS

Doss unifies operational data and workflows, enabling teams to operate faster with fewer tools. Backed by an $18M Series A from Theory Ventures, Contrary Capital, General Catalyst, 47th Street Partners, Base Case Capital, 20Sales, and more.

If you're passionate about engineering the backbone of software that supercharges operators, let's connect. Apply now to shape the future of enterprise automation at Doss.

jobs.title: Director of Partnerships, Ecosystem & International Expansion
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

The Director of Partnerships, Ecosystem & International Expansion at Doss will architect and scale our most powerful growth levers: our partner ecosystem and international expansion. You will take over and evolve our successful partnership and channel motion into a high-throughput, global revenue engine. You will also spearhead our geographic growth strategy—owning GTM execution in Europe and other key markets. This role is directly responsible for our expansion into new verticals, regions, and partner categories, with executive-level influence on product, operations, and market strategy.

This is one of the most critical roles at Doss. Our path to 10x growth and $10M+ ARR runs through the work you’ll lead. You’ll drive the strategies and build the infrastructure that unlock compounding growth: international market entry, scaled indirect channels, deeper ecosystem integrations, and outsized partner influence. The future of Doss’s distribution—and much of its value—will be built through this role.

What you’ll do

0->1 Channels & GTM Expansion:

  • Identify, activate, and scale strategic partnerships with RSIs, GSIs, e-commerce platforms, financial software, 3PLs, and system integrators.

  • Launch new indirect channels, including developer and SDK partner programs, co-selling alliances, and solution bundles.

  • Operationalize structured partner tiers and programs, including legal docs, revenue attribution, and CRM instrumentation.

International Growth Leadership:

  • Lead our international expansion starting with EMEA, leveraging an established presence and strategic networks.

  • Stand up local go-to-market infrastructure via partnerships, alliances, and high-potential customer migration strategies.

  • Own playbook creation for international customer acquisition, onboarding, and lifecycle growth.

Ecosystem Development::

  • Grow and manage the “Anti ERP ERP Club” as a cornerstone thought leadership and partnership platform.

  • Develop and maintain ecosystem integrations and technical alliances that broaden our surface area in key verticals.

  • Ensure alignment between product roadmap and ecosystem partner needs to accelerate market pull and stickiness.

Executive Impact:

  • Report directly to the CEO and operate as a cross-functional GTM leader.

  • Interface with Product, Ops, Engineering, and Marketing to translate partner and market insights into execution.

  • Serve as a key external face of Doss for strategic partnerships, international customers, and the broader market.

What you're world-class at

  • Strategic Execution: You translate vision into scalable, repeatable programs and playbooks.

  • Global Ops: You’ve driven expansion across borders and know how to build where you aren’t yet present.

  • Multimodal GTM: You’ve built and run both technical integrations and business development motions.

  • Fast-Moving Leadership: You lead from the front, with a builder’s mindset and global context.

About you

  • High intensity: you know how to lead without being told to.

  • Strategic: you play long-term games with long-term people.

  • Curious: you ask great questions, and you ask them fast.

  • Founder energy: ideally, you're a current or former founder in the space—someone who's built partnerships, scaled products, and lived through zero-to-one and one-to-many inflection points.

  • Domain fluent: you've built or run supply chains, implemented ERP systems, or developed inventory management infrastructure firsthand. You understand the pain points because you’ve solved them.

We have top-notch benefits

  • Premium comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Unlimited PTO and mandatory US Holidays.

  • 401(k), immediate eligibility, non-matching.

  • Fitness, commuter (BART/MUNI/CalTrain), and equipment stipends.

  • Premier office space with snacks, drinks (caffeinated, carbonated, coffee).

  • Lunch catered into office 4 days per week.

  • Relocation assistance available.

Compensation

  • The salary range for this role is $195k-$265k OTE.

  • All compensation packages include equity because we believe employees building Doss deserve ownership. Salary and equity offered will be determined by several factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

jobs.title: Product Application Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

At DOSS we’re building an AI-native ERP to unlock the next generation of automation. Our team re-wrote 50 years of legacy software to drive a step-function improvement in how supply chain, operations, and finance organizations execute.

We need more people to help us build and sell. That's why we're hiring Product Application Engineers to support our Core Operations team.

Position Overview:

Core Operations (CoreOps) at Doss is a small group of “expert generalists” (Product Application Engineers) that are mobilized around the company’s hardest problems. They work directly with the CEO to identify critical directives, parachute into the part of the business that needs help, drive results, build processes, and then extract themselves.

Above all else, this role requires extremely high-quality judgement. The skills downstream of this: strong business acumen, analytical skills, precise communication, and finesse with customers. While specific areas of focus shift over time (DemandGen, Sales Ops, Implementation, Product, Talent, etc), individuals on this team will be working on the most important problems of today.

CoreOps is a fast-paced “future CEO factory” where ambitious generalists who want to build and sell can come to sharpen themselves surrounded by other A+ players.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Deliver results on mission-critical initiatives. Design, prioritize, and drive the execution of high-priority, high-scope projects, ensuring measurable outcomes that align with the company’s objectives.

  • Navigate our organization and our customers organizations. Align leadership and ICs to make decisions and deliver results.

  • Build processes that drive rigor. Go in, fix something, and put in a process to make sure it stays fixed.

  • Obsess over talent, find it, recruit it, develop it, organize it, mobilize it. CoreOps is about systematically increasing the output of the organization by making our people and systems better.

About You:

  • Exceptionally Good Judgement. In other words: you’re right, a lot. We find that high-performers make very few mistakes.

  • High-Intensity. You have experience in high-pressure roles within finance, consulting, or startup environments. These are your real preferences, not your stated preferences.

  • Intellectual Firepower. You cut through noise, synthesize, and get to the right answers fast.

  • Technical from 1st Principles. You can grok hard engineering and logic problems from a place of intuition, not memorization.

  • Systems Thinker. Everything in our business is highly interconnected across people, process, and technology. In order to make progress you need to be able to traverse it, untangle it, and put it back together.

Bonus Points:

  • Formal education in hard sciences, engineering, physics, or a related field.

  • Experience with large-scale software implementation, technical program management, or hardware engineering program management.

jobs.title: Customer Product Operations Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

At DOSS we’re building an AI-native ERP to unlock the next generation of automation. Our team re-wrote 50 years of legacy software to drive a step-function improvement in how supply chain, operations, and finance organizations execute. We are scaling quick and this is a great opportunity to join a rapidly growing organization and drive impact within DOSS and our customers!!

Position Overview

The Customer product implementation team is the core engine of DOSS and its customers. This unique role sits at the intersection of customer partnership, operations and product - part operator, part product manager/ops and part consultant.

As a client/customer product implementation lead, you’ll partner with cross functional client leadership to analyze their operational and financial workflows (flow of goods, information and money) and bring those processes to life within the DOSS product and platform. You will lead the entire product implementation lifecycle from kickoff, spec (workflows, business and functional requirements), product design, build/configuration on DOSS ERP platform and go-live.

The role is a great fit for someone with a strong ownership mindset since you will own customer relationships and solutions implementation directly → ensuring each client achieves operational excellence and success through DOSS.

While having previous ERP or industry experience is always a plus, it is not a pre-requisite. Our current team comes from a mix of business and technical backgrounds. What we value the most are:

  • ownership/accountability

  • Customer obsession (including client/stakeholder management)

  • Appetite for operational and technical details

  • Business acumen to zoom out and discuss value drivers

  • Passion for learning quickly

Key Responsibilities

  • Own e2e post sales customer lifecycle from discovery, design, product implementation and go-live - you are responsible for ensuring client achieves success and value from DOSS

  • Conduct cross functional deep dives across customer organization to map end-to-end business processes and workflows

  • Translate process flows into product design and configuration within the DOSS platform

  • Collaborate with technical teams on integrations and data migrations required for successful implementations

  • Manage UAT, training, and go-live support, and build relationships with clients to drive retention and potentially upsell → turn our customers to our biggest advocates!!

  • Lead initiatives to drive improvements in DOSS product and customer lifecycle processes via automation and AI - we are an AI native company and team

About You:

  • 3–6 years in engineering (industrial, process, computer etc.), consulting, finance, operations, product operations or technical program management at a technology company - ERP experience not required (though if you have experience in that its a plus)

  • Systems Thinker. Everything in our business is highly interconnected across people, process, and technology. In order to make progress you need to be able to traverse it, untangle it, and put it back together.

  • High-Intensity. You have experience in high-pressure roles within startups, consulting, finance etc. - these are your real preferences, not your stated preferences.

  • Technical from 1st Principles. You can grok hard engineering and logic problems from a place of intuition, not memorization.

  • Intellectual Firepower. You cut through noise, synthesize, and get to the right answers fast.

  • Strong analytical mindset; experience with SQL is a plus (but not required)
